Display Note: High-yield corporate bond risk premium over Treasuries
Description: ICE BofA US High Yield Index Option-Adjusted Spread
Known Quirks: Index composition changes over time; pre-2000 methodology differs

Display Note: Investment-grade corporate bond risk premium
Description: ICE BofA US Corporate Index Option-Adjusted Spread
Known Quirks: Includes all IG-rated bonds; composition shifts with ratings migration

Display Note: BB-rated high-yield bond risk premium
Description: ICE BofA BB US High Yield Index OAS
Known Quirks: BB is the highest quality HY tier; composition changes with fallen angels

Display Note: CCC-rated (riskiest) high-yield bond risk premium
Description: ICE BofA CCC & Lower US High Yield Index OAS
Known Quirks: Most volatile OAS series; spikes during stress; thin market segments

Display Note: US 10-year government bond interest rate
Known Quirks: Market holidays cause gaps; constant maturity interpolation

Display Note: US 3-month government bond interest rate
Known Quirks: Can go negative during extreme flight-to-quality

Display Note: US 2-year government bond interest rate
Known Quirks: Highly sensitive to Fed rate expectations

Display Note: Chicago Fed measure of US financial conditions (negative = loose, positive = tight)
Description: Chicago Fed National Financial Conditions Index
Known Quirks: Weekly release; forward-filled to daily — induces autocorrelation

Display Note: The interest rate banks charge each other for overnight loans
BBB-rated (lowest investment-grade) bond risk premium
Description: ICE BofA BBB US Corporate Index OAS
Known Quirks: BBB is the cliff-edge rating tier; sensitive to downgrade fears

Display Note: Federal Reserve measure of financial market stress (higher = more stress)
Description: St. Louis Fed Financial Stress Index (v4)
Known Quirks: Weekly release; STLFSI4 is the current version (STLFSI2 discontinued ~2022)

Display Note: Weekly count of new unemployment benefit applications
Known Quirks: Weekly release; holiday-adjusted; COVID spike to 6M+ in 2020

Display Note: Secured overnight financing rate — replacement for LIBOR
Known Quirks: Starts ~April 2018; occasional quarter-end spikes

Display Note: S&P 500 index fund price
Description: SPDR S&P 500 ETF Trust — Adjusted Close
Known Quirks: Adjusted for splits and dividends

Display Note: Market fear gauge — expected stock market volatility over next 30 days
Known Quirks: Not directly investable; mean-reverting; spikes during crises

Display Note: Expected stock market volatility over next 3 months
Known Quirks: Starts ~2007; shorter history than VIX

Display Note: US bank stocks index fund price
Description: SPDR S&P Bank ETF — Adjusted Close
Known Quirks: Starts ~2005; equal-weighted bank ETF

Display Note: Small-company stocks index fund price
Known Quirks: Starts ~2000; small-cap benchmark

Display Note: Bond market fear gauge — expected Treasury volatility
Known Quirks: May be unavailable on Yahoo Finance; bond market equivalent of VIX

Display Note: Price of gold — a traditional safe-haven asset
Known Quirks: Futures contract; roll dates cause minor discontinuities

Display Note: Price of copper — a barometer of global economic health
Known Quirks: Futures contract; roll dates cause minor discontinuities

Display Note: Value of the US dollar against a basket of major currencies
Known Quirks: Euro-heavy basket; may have gaps on non-US holidays

Display Note: High-yield corporate bond fund price — tracks junk bond market
Description: iShares iBoxx $ High Yield Corporate Bond ETF — Adjusted Close
Known Quirks: Starts ~2007; ETF discount/premium to NAV during stress

Display Note: Difference between high-yield and investment-grade risk premiums — the core signal
Known Quirks: Widens during stress, tightens during calm

Display Note: How unusual is today's spread compared to the past year (0 = normal, >2 = elevated)
Known Quirks: Requires 252 obs to initialize; first ~1 year is NaN

Display Note: How unusual is today's spread compared to the past 2 years
Known Quirks: Requires 504 obs to initialize; first ~2 years NaN

Display Note: Where today's spread ranks vs the past 2 years (0.5 = median, 0.95 = very high)
Known Quirks: Bounded 0-1; requires 504 obs

Display Note: Where today's spread ranks vs the past 5 years
Known Quirks: Bounded 0-1; requires 1260 obs (~5 years)

Display Note: How much the spread changed over the past month (%)
Description: 21-day rate of change of HY-IG spread
Known Quirks: Percentage change; can be extreme from low base

Display Note: How much the spread changed over the past quarter (%)
Description: 63-day rate of change of HY-IG spread
Known Quirks: Percentage change

Display Note: How much the spread changed over the past 6 months (%)
Description: 126-day rate of change of HY-IG spread
Known Quirks: Percentage change

Display Note: Absolute change in spread over 1 month
Known Quirks: Absolute change, not percentage

Display Note: Absolute change in spread over 3 months
Known Quirks: Absolute change

Display Note: Absolute change in spread over 1 year
Known Quirks: Absolute change

Display Note: Is the spread change speeding up or slowing down?
Description: Change in 21d RoC over 21 days (second derivative)
Known Quirks: Second derivative; noisy

Display Note: Risk premium difference between junkiest and least-junky high-yield bonds
Description: CCC OAS minus BB OAS (quality spread within HY)
Known Quirks: Widens sharply during credit events; thin CCC market

Display Note: How volatile the spread has been over the past month
Description: 21-day rolling std of daily spread changes
Known Quirks: Clusters during stress

Display Note: Difference between 3-month and 1-month fear gauges (negative = near-term panic)
Known Quirks: Negative = backwardation (near-term stress); starts when VIX3M starts

Display Note: Yield curve slope — negative means recession warning
Known Quirks: Classic recession indicator; negative = inverted curve

Display Note: Another yield curve slope measure — negative = recession signal
Known Quirks: More volatile than 10Y-3M; popular media indicator

Display Note: Relative performance of banks vs small companies — credit health indicator
Known Quirks: Starts when KBE starts (~2005)

Display Note: Are financial conditions tightening or loosening over the past quarter?
Description: NFCI minus NFCI lagged 65 business days
Known Quirks: Based on weekly NFCI, forward-filled to daily

Display Note: Risk premium for being at the edge of investment grade
Known Quirks: Sensitive to downgrade risk at the IG/HY boundary

Display Note: S&P 500 return over the next trading day
Known Quirks: Look-ahead variable — NOT for use as a predictor

Display Note: S&P 500 return over the next week
Known Quirks: Look-ahead variable

Display Note: S&P 500 return over the next month
Known Quirks: Look-ahead variable

Display Note: S&P 500 return over the next quarter
Known Quirks: Look-ahead variable

Display Note: S&P 500 return over the next 6 months
Known Quirks: Look-ahead variable

Display Note: S&P 500 return over the next year
Known Quirks: Look-ahead variable; last 252 obs are NaN
